text: Can you describe or show what you have tried and what is not working?

Is there a documentation though on the response JSON that HubSpot needs to reply to users?
Or is it just botMessage: and quickReply:
<@U01QVR44MEY> thank you for this. I had already tried something similar but tried this just in case but unfortunately I’m getting the same results :disappointed:
Is there other replies?
Other then quickReply?
What kind of reply you need?

Btw... I created this for demo purposes couple of days ago. Maybe this helps you
<https://gist.github.com/samisund/e8ed3644b21e6a4712ea719ea6991e5b>
Really weird that it’s saying message is not a string but it is?
It works if if the json doesn’t have userMessage there. But the message input has to be a child of userMessage.
Sorry, I don't understand without seeing the code.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/webhooks-in-bots>
<@U04UQ8CTT32> just responded in the new thread you created
Very interesting, I just ran this code on my end and everything came back fine
Was it the exact same error the 401 one?
of course

Maybe!! Haha! I was going to test some other values in the API to see if it set it automatically. 

To try and reverse engineer it, I was going to use set property, add note, etc to see which ones brings back values.

Does anybody know what the association type id is of file to engagement? I've been using the engagements and associations api, but it doesn't can't infer the object type from "file" or "Files" or "attachment." I want to be able to associate multiple files to a note in a ticket.
You update the attachmentids field to attach attachments to engagements
thank you!!!!!
yeah of course
I was looking at that page, but for some reason it didn't click that that was a property, not an association.
you're good bro, it's a weird thing

Hello everyone,
I was trying to test this CRM endpoint */crm/v3/timeline/events* from this page <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline> to create a single timeline event on a test contact of mine. I have an app connected to a test portal (it appears among the "connected apps" on the HS portal, not in "private apps", so I guess it is a public app) where I created an event template directly via the UI, along with some custom tokens.
Now, if I click on "test call" I'm presented with the options OAuth or private app for the access token and I suppose I have to use the former, right? Well, where do I retrieve it? Provided it is really possible to test this endpoint from the doc page linked above. Otherwise, does this require to be implemented at the backend level?
You need to use an OAuth token for that portal
Here's how to generate an oauth token:<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
Thank you for your confirmation!
of course
Yup the exact same error :shrug:

Hello everyone,

I have a problem, it's a quite simple problem but I can't find an easy solution. I need to associate a child and a parent company based off of a custom property. Once the property is set, I need to associate both companies together. The only solution I found is to create a public app with a webhook but I'd like to do it in a workflow, is it possible ?

Thank you
I tried updating the version of PHP in use and I also updated composer and jigsaw but still the same error
You can do with with a custom code action in workflows
To be fair, as I said, I inherited this and we are moving over to the HubSpot CMS soon so I might just embed the forms instead :+1:
I tried but I can't make it work, I can't make the api call inside the code
Do you want to share the code?
you probably have a small problem in it
Yeah embedding the form is a great option but this code should work that's why I think it's strange
Are you using a variable in place of the private app token?

I'm trying to make a simple put request like this :
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/associate-objects?__hstc=192971698.74810b29e6e73b972437e179849e577b.1678964753980.1678964753980.1678973941859.2&__hssc=192971698.7.1678973941859&__hsfp=910104119&_ga=2.206782868.66076108.1678964754-1368669444.1678964754|https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/crm-associations/associate-objects?__hstc=19[…]_ga=2.206782868.66076108.1678964754-1368669444.1678964754>
but I'm having issues with the authorization.
Yeah that really not how you want to do it
I would suggest using the v4 association endpoints
well, the v3 doesn't allow me to make parent-child associations
Sorry v4
You can do labels in v4
It is very strange. I tested it with a variable for the headers like you code above and with putting the bearer token directly into the request and got the same issue both times
oh okay, I'll try it out, thanks
Can you use that same token for other requests?
did you run any tests in postman?
Of course
<#C019VT42R8X|workflows> is where you'll want to post if you're having trouble with the CCA
This site has been build on top of so many times that it probably isn’t the code above that is causing the problem but some underlying issue with hold old the version of laravel, php, and jigsaw are
okay, I wasn't sure where to ask
you're totally good, not a problem at all
Yes I ran a test in Postman and it ran perfectly so I know it works but there is just some conflict with the legacy code I think
yeah sorry I couldn't be more helpful in that department

Hi all! Just joined this Slack community. Nice to meet you all. I have a question regarding an API error message relating to proper permissions. First, what I’m trying to do is create a timeline event template as described in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline|this doc>. I created a private app and under ‘Scopes’ I selected a ‘timeline’ permission scope only. I’ve made the POST call to create the timeline event template, but encountered this error message: “”This oauth-token (***-***-******) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [developers-write])“. However, I could not locate these ‘developers-write’ permissions. Where can I enable that, and if someone can point me to the solution here. Thanks a lot in advance!
That’s not a problem at all. Thanks for response :smile:
timeline events are not available on private apps, only standard apps
You need to create the template using a developer key and a public app
Here's how to create a public app: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-app>
I see. It’s weird because I’m not seeing anywhere on my dashboard a place to create “public apps”. This is what I see\
You need to create a public app from a developer account not a normal account
Per the above doc:
I see. So in this type of account, I’ll also have the developer API key you mentioned, right?
Correct

Thanks! So I’m currently learning the basics before starting to develop. I am working on our organization’s dev account, but I noticed what you said that I’m viewing the regular type of account. Where in the settings of our org can I change my view/account_type to developer account? I don’t need to create a new developer account, just to develop on our org’s account
if that makes sense
Unless your org has a dev account setup you'll need to set one up
you would see the dev account in the portal options, but if you don't see one you might need to create one

I apologize in advance if this is a bit confused <@U01QVR44MEY>. I would like the app I’m creating to create the timeline events related to an existing account (in which I do not see developer options as you’ve seen). If I create a developer account that is separate, will the app I’d build there have access to the other account’s contact timeline events?
Yes you'll have to install the app on the account you want the timeline events to pop up on

Ahh I see. Thanks! And security-wise, as you  are experienced with HubSpot, do you have any recommended docs to read? Mostly, is it safe to have an app installed from a ‘public’, separate account on an organization’s account? I assume that since the public app is protected with my developer key that it’s mostly okay.

Yeah so public apps are just apps the have different capabilities like CRM cards and webhooks they also have the option (it's not necessary in this situation) to put the app on the marketplace. So it's completely safe just as safe as a private app
Got it. By the way, if it’s not in the marketplace, how can it be found and added on the account I want to add it to?
Yes
Through the app's settings page
Any particular doc or method to do that? You’ve already helped me a great deal, just trying to figure out the final steps
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1678980294181779?thread_ts=1678980117.097489&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

I need to get the dates when a deal transitioned between stages - for all the deal stages including custom stages.  The only place I can see the data is in the event stream. How can i get all the events associated with a deal?

Thank you.
David

Hi everyone I have an app that adds a number of custom workflow actions and I upload them through the API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions|docs>. If I create an action through a post request that has a 'labels.en.outputFieldLabels' property defined,  the response from the post request also had a 'labels.en.outputFieldLabels' property. Then if I try to get this custom action through a get request it is missing the 'labels.en.outputFieldLabels' property but everything else is identical to the response of the post request. This doesn't feel like intended behavior?

Thanks
Are you possibly forgetting to set the active to live mode?
That's something that I've forgot to do before
sorry I am a bit new to HubSpot is that to make the action active is like turning it on?
Yeah so like it's possible you're looking at the non published version instead of the published version. It would also be helpful if you shared at least the core parts of the request
because that's not really the issue the issue is that the GET requests to retrieve the actions definition is just missing that single property
`"published": true`, in the body
I will try to prepare an example
Sorry this is maybe not the easiest way to view but
<https://pastebin.com/VzVd9jpy>
Any suggestions?
